revised_title: Amino Acids and Peptides: Fast and Slow Chemical Signals in the Nervous System
tldr: This lecture discusses the role of amino acids, specifically GABA and L-glutamate, as fast neurotransmitters in the nervous system. GABA is the principal inhibitory neurotransmitter, while L-glutamate is believed to be the predominant excitatory transmitter. The author also explores the modulatory roles of peptides and monoamines in the nervous system.
